subject: Re: [junit] Re: Sample code for using JUnit on SOAP-based service-oriented architecture
msgSnippet: ... I hadn t thought of that. I guess I haven t had spammers try to send me links. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software
messageBody:
Andreas Guther wrote:

> The problem with URL compactors like TinyUrl is that you do not know
> where the short URL actually brings you to. If the tiny URL comes from
> a trusted person, it is a perfect tool.

I hadn't thought of that. I guess I haven't had spammers try to send me
links.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
